snippet: A new deal on foreclosure abuses does more for banks than for borrowers.
abstract: Editorial criticizes deal reached between Federal Reserve and Office of Comptroller of Currency with 10 banks, under which regulators will end reviews of foreclosure practices and banks will provide $8.5 billion in aid to borrowers; contends deal does more for banks than borrowers and does little to prevent banks from engaging in questionable foreclosure practices in future.
lead_paragraph: A new deal on foreclosure abuses does more for banks than for borrowers.

headline.seo: Another Slap on the Wrist for Big Banks

keywords.value: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency
keywords.name: organizations
